content.description: Thoughtful moves to the finishing crux roof.  This crux has seen a lot of airtime and there are several options for surmounting--bold direct, sneaky left, something in between.  Any way you go will be exciting.  Shake off the adrenaline and head for the anchors.
content.location: Obviously discolored (wet spot) area 30' right of Delicate Sound of Falling.  Last route to dry and the first to get wet.

content.description: Located down the wall to the right, tucked in the trees,   this route starts with a crack & then moves to edgy face climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: trad rack and a few bolts.
content.location: To the right of The Right Arete

content.description: Can you spell T.H.I.N.  Climb through the chossy 1st 15' and then enjoy sustained Tai Chi-like moves to the anchors.
content.location: Right of and shares anchors with the Campus Wolfgang project

content.description: Follow the bolted face through the roof and head to the top via the small tricky crack.
Sustained thin and balancy.  Don't panic all the holds are where you need them...unless you're under 5'5" then add a letter grade.
content.protection: QDs (12-14?). May need a clip stick if you're short.
content.location: Bolted arete left of Wet Spot.

content.description: Campusing a bunch on this route, stay out of the crack (birds nests) and the arete. Stay on the face and do what Wolfgang did Crimp!
content.location: Next bolted line right of Wet Spot, starts on shattered block about 12' up, first bolt in open book on left side of column. Shares anchors with Todd Skinner.

content.description: Tall walls and lots of roofs define this hard climbing area!
